title: Linux zipinfo Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the powerful zipinfo command in Linux, learn its options, and analyze the contents of zip files with practical examples.

meta.title: Linux zipinfo Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the powerful zipinfo command in Linux, learn its options, and analyze the contents of zip files with practical examples.
meta.keywords: zipinfo, Linux, compression, archiving, zip file, file analysis

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo command output includes the three file names (file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt) that were added to the sample.zip file.

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo -l command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo -l command output includes the three file names (file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt) that were added to the sample.zip file.

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo -v command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo -v command output includes the three file names (file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt) that were added to the sample.zip file.

steps.title: Analyze Zip File Contents with zipinfo

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo -z command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo -z command output includes the details for the file1.txt file within the sample.zip archive.

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo -p command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo -p command output includes the contents of the file2.txt file within the sample.zip archive.

verify.name: Verify the zipinfo -s command output
verify.hint: Make sure the zipinfo -s command output includes the expected compression statistics for the sample.zip archive.
